intro: Cerinthe glabra subsp. smithiae, commonly known as the smooth cerinthe, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces striking blue or violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its compact growth habit and long blooming period.
